Class EmailMessage

java.lang.Object
com.example.emails.EmailMessage
public class EmailMessage extends Object
Represents an immutable email message with sender, subject, body content and the received date.

Instances of this class are immutable: the textual fields are final and the Date field is defensively copied on construction and access to avoid exposing internal mutable state.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • EmailMessage

      public EmailMessage(String from, String subject, String content, Date receivedDate)
      Constructs an EmailMessage.
      Parameters:
      from - sender identifier or address, may be null
      subject - subject line, may be null
      content - message body, may be null
      receivedDate - date/time when the message was received; a defensive copy is created (if null no copy is made)

    • getReceivedDate

      public Date getReceivedDate()
      Returns a defensive copy of the received date.
      Returns:
      a new Date instance equal to the original received date, or null if the original date was null
